intro: Zephyranthes leptandra, commonly known as the pink fairy lantern, is a small, flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped pink flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette, while its stems are short and sturdy. Zephyranthes leptandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also known for its ability to naturalize in suitable environments.
